comment._content: This is great! I'll have to  see if I can take photo from a similar place showing today's view.

comment.author: 32741315@N06
comment._content: That would be great to see, borealnz. Have you seen the Flickr/Google street view mashup Paul Hagon has made with these geo-tagged images? Unfortunately, this pic of the Gardens doesn't work on it (as the Google car doesn't appear to have gone off-road!) but some of the street scenes work beautifully.
comment.authorname: National Library NZ on The Commons

comment.author: 32285806@N04
comment._content: Looks like the photographers POV is from North Road entrance adjacent to where the current turn off to pine hill and northern motorway in Dunedin is.  The cricket and soccer ground is to the left across the road. The hot/ glasshouses are evident by the white builidngs below what appears to be a sequoia tree. Therer are now extensive rose beds in the foreground. This pic must be post  about WW2?

comment.author: 32741315@N06
comment._content:
Thanks for that gutenblerg2. The dates we have for these panoramas by Moore are between 1923-1928 - is there a reason why you think it's likely to be post-war?

Courtney
comment.authorname: National Library NZ on The Commons

comment.author: 32285806@N04
comment._content: The height of the sequoia tree but now the clothes of the children on 'all sizes view' do seem to support an earlier date.
